body.p:
Office of the Chief of Police,
Louisville, Ky., July 21 1865
To his Excellency
JThos. F. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

On the afternoon of the 20th inst, Hon Caleb Stinson Ex Representative of the Legislature from Grayson Co was foully waylaid & murdered^mortally wounded^ by B. F. Dewees of same county The only reason alleged for the act was the fear of Mr Stinson's exposing some rascality of said Dewees and bringing him to justice -- If it would please your Excellency to offer the customary reward for the apprehension
of the murderer, it would no doubt facilitate his capture --
Said Dewees is ^about 32 years old^ five feet ten inches high -- red hair blue eyes, ^no whiskers^ sandy complexion had the end of his nose bitten off some years ago -- ^is^ weighs about 180 lbs --

Reward
$300,
B. F. Dewees
$300,
Offered
24 July/65
